paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The hotspot variant (p.T618I) causes a major gain of function in IKr, leading to acceleration of repolarization, which underlies the abbreviation of the QT interval.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a gain of function in the potassium channel, leading to shortened QT intervals.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is one of the most common associated with SQTS.
key_quotes: The first genetic alteration associated with the disease was reported in 2004, located in the KCNH2 gene.
Currently, more than 30 rare variants have been identified in 8 genes, including KCNH2.

tables_processed.table_caption: Genes associated with Short QT Syndrome or Shorter than normal QT interval.

extraction_metadata.notes: All variants extracted were from the KCNH2 gene.
